Shooting zombies in the face? Check. Slight British comedic flavor? Check. Automatic shotgun? Check. Not deciding to change miniscule things and re-release it as "Killing Floor 2" less than a year after the first? Check. In my book, shit adds up to a solid FPS for random lulz. Hate the leveling system though, worse than grinding in a generic Korean F2P MMO.

Un FPS con multitud de mutantes maléficos hambrientos de carne huamana y varias profesiones que subir de nivel que cambian el precio y la pericia de varias armas y artilugios, interesante, cuanto menos.

A FPS with a lot evil mutants hungry for human flesh and several perks to level up that modify the prices and characteristics of some weapons and wares, interesting, at least.
Fun co-operative gameplay featuring several distinct classes each with their own unique perks and contributions to the team. Also, DOSH.

This game isn't the quintessential title for a lover of a good story, graphics, hardware specifications, genre, or anything of the ilk of subjective gaming experiences...

HOWEVER, I recommend it whole-heartedly for the vast array of extra content, the sound/music, and for the reason I believe everyone should play games... The gameplay.

This is not a game that's worth much conversation so I'll make this review short- It's an easy pick up and play shooter. The rank and experience awards give the game some much needed feelings of variance, depth, and longevity as the awards come at a slow and methodic pace, making you feel as though you earned every reward, and the rewards are enough to shake up gameplay to your favor enough to make the game feel like a variable of itself and the rewards become a ddicting to get. Because of this, you will want to play multiple sessions over and over again despite that the gameplay should feel repetitive; but thankfully it never does.

I haven't played this game in a while, but I guarantee I could get back on and be just as good as I last played thanks to the simplicity and substance this game has. It's a game you'll never forget how to play, but it will still be difficult to master, offering a veteran player not only the motivation, but the opportunity to play again without feeling a sense of loss, and re-treading old ground.
It's fun to play with friends who don't suck or to play with randoms named Rada who can't hit anything, take all the ammo, and then say 'u mad bro' when you start laughing at him.

A class based "zombie" killing game.
Technically theyarent zombies more genetically engineered freaks.
Each class you pick has certain perks/ weapon discounts which level up as you do.
Good saml team based fps action with a team of up to 6.

Gore factor ++++
Weapons are varied from the conventional SA80, AK47 flame thrower chainsaw and pipebombs.

Every now and again an event will happen such as the current one which gives special acheivement and skins.

A great game

This will bring you back to the game over and over again.

If you haven't heard of or played this game, you are seriously missing out on one of the best "Zombie" games to have ever hit the market. DLCs are awesome, character packs aren't overly expensive *cough* Activision with their $15 shit that Micro$oft started *cough*. It's the perfect zombie shooter: Awesome levels to play in, everything in the game has stunning detail, the firepower vs. difficulty of zombies are balanced as well (no L4D2-esque goofy  items like adrenaline & boomer bile that makes the game unrealistic from what the L4D1 experience was). Ammo isn't infinite, so you have to buy it or find ammo/weapon drops that are dispersed throughout the level. And even when you have plenty of ammo, don't be so sure you're completely safe. Even if you don't get it now during the Summer Sale where the game and character packs aren't on sale, everything is STILL worth the full price, because is truly is a memorable experience, time and time again. This one's going to be around for a while.
great game with buddies. Only qualm is that it can be a bit of a grind.

Killing Floor is wave-based and class-based, providing a well-worked mix of class-based strategy, teamwork and tight gunplay that sets it above most other zombie shooters currently saturating the market. There’s lots of fun in leveling and figuring out the best strategies per map with your mates. The game also boasts some of the best iron sights and post-release support I’ve seen to date. The main downside is the horrid net-coding and the occasional visual glitch. The bottom line: Do you like zombie games? Do you have friends? Yes? Buy.

A unique co-op horror fps romp, that is pretty much what you'd expect. Awesome weapons, loads of achievements, and perks to supe up your character. That's what sets this game apart from say Left 4 Dead for example, the perk system allows you to unlock and accrue "boosts" to your character by completing in game objectives. I definitely recommend!

What can I say... more than a thousand hours of playtime and I still keep coming back for more. Bought it on day one of its release and I haven't regretted my purchase eversince. Best game here on Steam IMHO... the devs updated game with tons of updates and the community has provided modifications that are commercial in quality. Even with the release of KF 2 this is still a go to game for me for a long time to come. Now what are you waiting for play this game... NOW! =)
